learning_outcomes.description: Communicate an appreciation for the importance of marketing to business success in a range of contexts.
Explain the central role of the customer, whether individual or organisational, in the marketing process.
Evaluate situational influences on marketing across a range of industries and companies.
Collect and analyse evidence to determine competitive advantage, target market and position.
Analyse marketing evidence to evaluate and determine the effectiveness of marketing mix strategies.

assessments.task_description:
An online quiz will be run in Week 5 during the scheduled time, via the course blackboard site, in Assessments>Assessment 1 online quiz.

The quiz is designed to engage students in early exploration of marketing theory. The quiz will cover all content from Week 1, 2, and 3 lectures, as well as Week 2, 3 and 4 tutorials and all readings from these weeks (Chapters 1, 2, 3,and 5). Questions and answer orders will be randomly generated. The quiz will be available to complete during the scheduled time only, which is a 24 hour window, where students are to complete the quiz individually and will have 30 minutes to complete the quiz once it is commenced. Further instructions and details will be available in the Assessment folder. All students MUST follow the specific guidelines provided.

Students MUST complete the quiz during the scheduled time. Students who fail to follow the guidelines and who have technical issues will be deemed responsible and will incur the outcome. Formal applications are essential for anyone not able to sit - no extension will be provided by course staff - this must be formally managed by students.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The aim of this assessment task is to increase knowledge of the segmenting, targeting and positioning. Learners will perform a review of a designated product brand (an actual real life market offering), examining the marketing theory and the market evidence to determine the current STP. In doing so, learners will need to consult marketing literature, research industry information, apply marketing theory and present their findings in a written report, with full assignment requirements available via Learn.UQ and discussed in classes prior to assessments commencing.

A maximum word limit has been set in the guidelines available via Learn.UQ and any words submitted above the maximum limit will not be eligible for marking.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The written assignment must be submitted electronically through the Online Turnitin Submission on the Learn.UQ site, based on the specific instructions provided. Those who fail to follow the exact submission instructions will incur late penalties until submission is resolved.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The aim of this final exam task is to increase knowledge of the marketing mix and demonstrate your understanding as an individual. This will include evaluation of theoretical knowledge and the ability to apply knowledge to real life marketing, using multiple choice questions and short answer questions. Further details of the final exam will be discussed in tutorials and lectures.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
